content.raw: just checking about the new API style, maybe I am too late here but I see that there are many places where we use `SetXXX` as recommended by [style guide](https://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/cppguide.html#Function_Names). In this instance here we're directly calling `Translate` and not `SetTranslate`? `Translate` could also mean that that we're translating the current transform by `offset` and not setting the translation component to a new value.
content.html: just checking about the new API style, maybe I am too late here but I see that there are many places where we use SetXXX as recommended by style guide. In this instance here we're directly calling Translate and not SetTranslate? Translate could also mean that that we're translating the current transform by offset and not setting the translation component to a new value.

pullrequest.title: Ign math integration with common library, part 1

content.raw: There are places in ignition math where we don't follow the style guide. There is no `SetTranslate` function in ign-math, and the `Translate` function does set the translation component of the matrix. I'd prefer not to change ign-math's api right now.
content.html: There are places in ignition math where we don't follow the style guide. There is no SetTranslate function in ign-math, and the Translate function does set the translation component of the matrix. I'd prefer not to change ign-math's api right now.

pullrequest.title: Ign math integration with common library, part 1

content.raw: You are correct. We should start following the style guide more closely when it comes to function names.
content.html: You are correct. We should start following the style guide more closely when it comes to function names.

pullrequest.title: Ign math integration with common library, part 1
Ign math integration with common library, part 1

content.raw:
I'd prefer to not change both the function name and parameter types with the ignition::math conversion. It will be easier for people to simply change types instead of changing both types and function names. So, for the ignition math changes we are trying to only change types.

There are caveats when the function name has to change due to symbol conflicts. These are unavoidable, but should be kept to a minimum.
content.html:
I'd prefer to not change both the function name and parameter types with the ignition::math conversion. It will be easier for people to simply change types instead of changing both types and function names. So, for the ignition math changes we are trying to only change types.

There are caveats when the function name has to change due to symbol conflicts. These are unavoidable, but should be kept to a minimum.
